member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClass
member.summary:
Provides a base class for dynamic objects.
In addition to the methods defined here, the following items are added using reflection: - default constructor - constructor with all the properties as parameters (if not linq-to-entities) - all properties (also with getter and setters) - ToString() method - Equals() method - GetHashCode() method

member.summary: Gets the dynamic property by name.
member.param: Name of the property.
member.returns: T

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClass.GetDynamicPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the dynamic property value by name.
member.param: Name of the property.
member.returns: value

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClass.SetDynamicPropertyValue``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sets the dynamic property value by name.
member.param: Name of the property.
The value.

member.summary: Sets the dynamic property value by name.
member.param: Name of the property.
The value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the with the specified name.
member.param: The name.
member.returns: Value from the property.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClass.GetDynamicMemberNames
member.summary: Returns the enumeration of all dynamic member names.
member.returns: A sequence that contains dynamic member names.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClass.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClass.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClassFactory
member.summary: A factory to create dynamic classes, based on .

member.name: F:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClassFactory.DynamicAssemblyName
member.summary: The AssemblyName

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClassFactory.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes the class.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClassFactory.CreateType(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicProperty},System.Boolean)
member.summary: The CreateType method creates a new data class with a given set of public properties and returns the System.Type object for the newly created class. If a data class with an identical sequence of properties has already been created, the System.Type object for this class is returned. Data classes implement private instance variables and read/write property accessors for the specified properties.Data classes also override the Equals and GetHashCode members to implement by-value equality. Data classes are created in an in-memory assembly in the current application domain. All data classes inherit from and are given automatically generated names that should be considered private (the names will be unique within the application domain but not across multiple invocations of the application). Note that once created, a data class stays in memory for the lifetime of the current application domain. There is currently no way to unload a dynamically created data class. The dynamic expression parser uses the CreateClass methods to generate classes from data object initializers. This feature in turn is often used with the dynamic Select method to create projections.
member.param: The DynamicProperties
Create a constructor with parameters. Default set to true. Note that for Linq-to-Database objects, this needs to be set to false.
member.returns: Type

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicClassFactory.GenerateKey(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicProperty},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates the key. Anonymous classes are generics based. The generic classes are distinguished by number of parameters and name of parameters. The specific types of the parameters are the generic arguments.
member.param: The dynamic propertys.
if set to true [create parameter ctor].

member.name: T:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of static (Shared in Visual Basic) methods for querying data structures that implement . It allows dynamic string based querying. Very handy when, at compile time, you don't know the type of queries that will be generated, or when downstream components only return column names to sort and filter by.

member.summary: Dynamically runs an aggregate function on the IQueryable.
member.param: The IQueryable data source.
The name of the function to run. Can be Sum, Average, Min or Max.
The name of the property to aggregate over.
member.returns: The value of the aggregate function run over the specified property.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.Any(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Determines whether a sequence contains any elements.
member.param: A sequence to check for being empty.

example.code: IQueryable queryable = employees.AsQueryable(); var result = queryable.Any();

member.returns: true if the source sequence contains any elements; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.Any(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.ParsingConfig,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Determines whether a sequence contains any elements.
member.param: A sequence to check for being empty.
The .
A function to test each element for a condition.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: true if the source sequence contains any elements; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines whether a sequence contains any elements.

member.summary: Returns the number of elements in a sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.DefaultIfEmpty(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Returns the elements of the specified sequence or the type parameter's default value in a singleton collection if the sequence is empty.
member.param: The to return a default value for if empty.

example.code: IQueryable queryable = employees.DefaultIfEmpty();

member.returns: An that contains default if source is empty; otherwise, source.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.DefaultIfEmpty(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the elements of the specified sequence or the type parameter's default value in a singleton collection if the sequence is empty.
member.param: The to return a default value for if empty.
The value to return if the sequence is empty.

example.code: IQueryable queryable = employees.DefaultIfEmpty(new Employee());

member.returns: An that contains defaultValue if source is empty; otherwise, source.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.GroupBy(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Groups the elements of a sequence according to a specified key string function and creates a result value from each group and its key.
member.param: A whose elements to group.
A string expression to specify the key for each element.
A string expression to specify a result value from each group.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: A where each element represents a projection over a group and its key.

example.code: var groupResult1 = queryable.GroupBy("NumberPropertyAsKey", "StringProperty"); var groupResult2 = queryable.GroupBy("new (NumberPropertyAsKey, StringPropertyAsKey)", "new (StringProperty1, StringProperty2)");

example.code: var groupResult1 = queryable.GroupBy("NumberPropertyAsKey", "StringProperty"); var groupResult2 = queryable.GroupBy("new (NumberPropertyAsKey, StringPropertyAsKey)", "new (StringProperty1, StringProperty2)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.GroupJoin(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Correlates the elements of two sequences based on equality of keys and groups the results. The default equality comparer is used to compare keys.
member.param: The first sequence to join.
The sequence to join to the first sequence.

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.Select(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence into a new form.
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a projection string on each element of source.

example.code: var singleField = queryable.Select("StringProperty"); var dynamicObject = queryable.Select("new (StringProperty1, StringProperty2 as OtherStringPropertyName)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.Select``1(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence into a new class of type TResult. Details see .
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a projection string on each element of source.

example.code: var users = queryable.Select<User>("new (Username, Pwd as Password)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.Select(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Type,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence into a new class of type TResult. Details see http://solutionizing.net/category/linq/
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
The result type.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a projection string on each element of source.

example.code: var users = queryable.Select(typeof(User), "new (Username, Pwd as Password)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.SelectMany(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence to an and combines the resulting sequences into one sequence.
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a one-to-many projection function on each element of the input sequence.

example.code: var roles = users.SelectMany("Roles");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.SelectMany(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Type,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence to an and combines the resulting sequences into one sequence.
member.param: A sequence of values to project.
A projection string expression to apply to each element.
The result type.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking a one-to-many projection function on each element of the input sequence.

example.code: var permissions = users.SelectMany(typeof(Permission), "Roles.SelectMany(Permissions)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.SelectMany``1(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.Object[])

example.code: var permissions = users.SelectMany<Permission>("Roles.SelectMany(Permissions)");

member.name: M:System.Linq.Dynamic.Core.DynamicQueryableExtensions.SelectMany(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Projects each element of a sequence to an and invokes a result selector function on each element therein. The resulting values from each intermediate sequence are combined into a single, one-dimensional sequence and returned.

A projection function to apply to each element of the input sequence.
A projection function to apply to each element of each intermediate sequence. Should only use x and y as parameter names.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
member.returns: An whose elements are the result of invoking the one-to-many projection function on each element of source and then mapping each of those sequence elements and their corresponding source element to a result element.

A projection function to apply to each element of the input sequence.

A projection function to apply to each element of each intermediate sequence.
The name from resultParameterName to use. Default is y.
An object array that contains zero or more objects to insert into the predicate as parameters. Similar to the way String.Format formats strings.
